meanings.definition: A circular object that revolves on an axle and is fixed below a vehicle or other object to enable it to move easily over the ground.
meanings.sent1: The wheel on the bike spun quickly.
meanings.sent2: The car's wheel got stuck in the mud.
meanings.sent3: The wheel on the shopping cart squeaked loudly.
meanings.sent4: Time is a wheel that never stops turning.
meanings.sent5: The Ferris wheel at the fair was brightly lit up at night.

meanings.definition: A circular object that revolves on an axle and forms part of a machine.
meanings.sent1: The steering wheel of the car was smooth to touch.
meanings.sent2: The wheel on the factory machine turned steadily.
meanings.sent3: The wheel on the clock seemed to tick louder than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a wheel of constant thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The spinning wheel in the textile factory was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: A circular object that revolves on an axle and is used for steering or driving a vehicle or machine.
meanings.sent1: The ship's wheel guided the vessel through the storm.
meanings.sent2: The steering wheel of the truck was difficult to turn.
meanings.sent3: The wheel on the toy car popped off during the race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was the driving wheel of her success.
meanings.sent5: The steering wheel of the bus was huge and hard to miss.
